Christian Kohlschuetter wrote:

> Dear all,
>
> I have probably found another code hotspot, which unnecessarily 
> decelerates
> crawling, and also leads to OOME.
>
> ....

> To sum it up, we have three problems here:
> 1. (Heritrix) There is no way to turn off cookie support (would be a
> quick-fix).
> 2. (Heritrix/HttpClient) Cookies are kept in memory (instead of bdb etc.)
> 3. (HttpClient) HttpState access to cookies is sluggish (by 
> implementation and
> API).
>
> I would still regard them not as bugs but RFEs, because breadth-first 
> crawls
> still are experimental. However, I would assign a high priority.

On 1., in the above, I just committed an option to disable cookies.  On 
2., in the above, yes, we've noticed this doing memory profiling.  On 
3., very interesting.  Stands to reason I suppose given its an ArrayList.

We should try and figure a patch that we can contribute back to the good 
folks at apache httpclient.

I've made an RFE for 2. and 3: 
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1208757&group_id=73833&atid=539102

>
> And finally, adding the stacktrace dump to ToeThread.report() would 
> also be a
> nice enhancement IMHO. To keep Java 1.4 compatibility, I suggest to 
> keep that
> feature in a special class which is only loaded if Java > 5.0 is 
> present. (I
> will file an RFE with a patch soon).


I committed the above contribution of Christian's.  I'd recommend list 
members go check out this sweet addition (Get latest build and look at 
ToeThreads report running Heritrix using a 1.5.0 JVM. Notice the added 
stack traces).

Great stuff Christian,
St.Ack
